page.title: 14THE POTTERY, CLYRO.
page.content: {Adam Dworski,}a lawyer from Yugoslavia, came to Clyro in 1956. At that time he was one of only four potters in Wales. Mr. Dworski produces a distinctive type of earthenware pottery using { {Majolica Glazes}and{Brushwork {Decoration.}He also makes figures, plaques and pots in oxydised stoneware and has recently started to work in {porcelain. A self taught potter, he sells his work direct to people visiting his studio and through many shops in the U.K. He also exports to Europe and America. The pottery is situated at the old gateway of the drive to the old vicarage and was originally part of the stable block.{Mrs. Dworski}sells {painted furniture}from her studio at the rear of the pottery.
